meanings.sent2: It is not right to vulgarize such a beautiful piece of art.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to vulgarize the serious topic, but it fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Her crude jokes vulgarize the atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the wall vulgarizes the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To lower in value or quality by adding elements of vulgarity.
meanings.sent1: They vulgarize the brand with tasteless advertisements.
meanings.sent2: The use of inappropriate language can vulgarize a conversation.
meanings.sent3: Adding glitter to the painting would vulgarize its elegance.
meanings.sent4: His behavior vulgarizes the reputation of the company.
meanings.sent5: The reality show aims to vulgarize the contestants for entertainment.

meanings.sent1: The mass production process vulgarizes the product.
meanings.sent2: The commercialization of holidays can vulgarize their meaning.
meanings.sent3: The overuse of slang can vulgarize language.
meanings.sent4: The fast-food chain vulgarizes the concept of dining out.
meanings.sent5: The trend of fast fashion vulgarizes the art of clothing design.
